molecular.geometry.angle¶

molecular.geometry.angle(a, b, c=None, method='atan2', degrees=False)[source]¶

Compute the angle between two vectors or three vertices.

If method = ‘atan2’,

..math :: theta = atan2(norm(cross(a, b)), dot(a, b))

If method = ‘acos’,

..math :: theta = acos frac{a dot b}{|a| |b|}

Parameters

  • a (ArrayLike) – Vectors with same dimensionality. Both a and b must be provided. If c is provided, all three are taken as vertices. Otherwise, a and b are assumed to be Euclidean vectors.

  • b (ArrayLike) – Vectors with same dimensionality. Both a and b must be provided. If c is provided, all three are taken as vertices. Otherwise, a and b are assumed to be Euclidean vectors.

  • c (ArrayLike) – Vectors with same dimensionality. Both a and b must be provided. If c is provided, all three are taken as vertices. Otherwise, a and b are assumed to be Euclidean vectors.

  • method (str) – Method to compute angle, see vangle() for options.

  • degrees (bool) – Should the output be in degrees? (Default: False)

Returns

Angle between vectors

Return type

float or numpy.ndarray
